abstract: Citigroup is locked in negotiations with federal regulators over whether it needs to raise as much as $10 billion in fresh capital as a result of the government’s stress test of its financial health, Eric Dash of The New York Times reported, citing a person briefed on the situation.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup is locked in negotiations with federal regulators over whether it needs to raise as much as $10 billion in fresh capital as a result of the government’s stress test of its financial health, Eric Dash of The New York Times reported, citing a person briefed on the situation.

headline.main: BofA and Citi Said to Need Billions More in Capital
